meanings.definition: A place where goods are bought and sold; a marketplace.
meanings.sent1: The bustling emporia in the town square offered a variety of goods.
meanings.sent2: I visited the emporia to buy fresh fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The emporia was so crowded that I accidentally bought a hat instead of a shirt.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an emporia of joy, lighting up the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The emporia buzzed with activity, drawing in customers from all around.

meanings.definition: A large retail store or shopping center.
meanings.sent1: The new emporia in the city is a one-stop shop for all your needs.
meanings.sent2: I love going to the emporia on weekends to browse through the latest fashion trends.
meanings.sent3: At the emporia, I found a quirky lamp that brightened up my living room.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled like gems found in a hidden emporia.
meanings.sent5: The emporia's grand opening attracted a huge crowd eager to explore its offerings.
